title: Flipped Learning-Based Language Structure Deep Analysis and Communication Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic grammar comprehension, vocabulary acquisition of 1,000+ words, adaptability to digital learning environments, foundational reading-writing skills, and ability to interpret simple texts
context.additional_context: Large-scale language education courses conducted in smartphone-centric, limited technological environments, emphasizing learner interaction and practical application skills. Focuses on improving grammar usage (sentence transformation/error correction), text interpretation (inference/critique), and oral expression (presentation/discussion) abilities. Learning data is managed through digital portfolios, including analysis of real-life language usage examples.

learning_goals: Learners will improve complex grammar structure and text analysis skills by 30% or more through a flipped learning model and strengthen context-specific vocabulary application abilities.
Learners will enhance oral presentation and document-based communication engagement by 40% or more through peer feedback activities and acquire critical feedback skills.
Learners will improve vocabulary expansion, grammar application, and reading comprehension test scores by 25% or more through weekly formative and summative assessments and build learning portfolios.

Learners will perform O-PIRTAS model-based activities (summarizing, testing, projects) three or more times weekly and achieve 4.0 or higher on a 5-point Likert self-directed learning habit scale at the end of a six-month course, along with submitting a learning strategy report.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
